definition[0]: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group
definition[1]: to give part of your power or work to someone in a lower position than you
example[1]: A good manager knows when to delegate.
example[2]: It takes experience to judge correctly how much power should be delegated.
example[3]: Minor tasks should be delegated to your assistant.
definition[2]: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc
example[4]: I was delegated to find a suitable conference venue.
example[5]: Delegates to the union’s annual meeting are expected to endorse the plans.
definition[3]: to give part of your power or work to someone else, usually someone in a lower position than you
example[6]: Decision-making on a day-to-day basis will be delegated to team managers.
definition[4]: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group
example[7]: I’ve been delegated to organize the weekly meetings.
